alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Summers (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 4:23PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Summers and central Mercer Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 423 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kegley, or near Princeton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Princeton... Athens... Camp Creek... Oakvale... Elgood... Spanishburg... and Kegley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
